intro: Isopogon attenuatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces bright red or orange flowers. It is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat. Isopogon attenuatus is often found in heathlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
